alert.note: Alert for White; Woodruff (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 21 at 7:16PM CST until further notice by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following river in Arkansas... White River At Augusta affecting White and Woodruff Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...White River At Augusta. * WHEN...From Wednesday morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 26.0 feet, Farm ground along the river in White and Woodruff counties begin to flood. Seasonal agricultural impacts. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:00 PM CST Tuesday the stage was 24.8 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage late Wednesday morning, then continuing to rise to 27.0 feet by Sunday morning. It will then slowly fall to 26.7 feet and begin rising again on Wednesday, December 29. It will rise to 26.8 feet on Thursday, December 30. Thereafter, the river will slowly begin to fall, but remain in minor flood stage. - Flood stage is 26.0 feet. - Flood History...No available flood history. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecast 6 PM Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Fri Crest Time Date White River Augusta 26.0 24.8 Tue 6 PM 26.5 26.9 27.0 27.0 12 AM 12/24 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. River forecasts are based on current conditions and rainfall forecasted to occur over the next 24 hours. During periods of flooding...Evening forecasts are reissued with updated rainfall forecasts. Observed and forecasted stage data plots are available on our Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service web page at... www.weather.gov/lzk Under the Current Conditions section...Select River and Lakes AHPS.
